form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Scott of South Carolina introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs

form.official-title: To amend title 41, United States Code, and title 10, United States Code, to provide best value through the multiple award schedule program, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Value Over Cost Act of 2025.

section.header: Providing best value through the multiple award schedule program

subsection.text: Section 152(3)(B) of title 41, United States Code, is amended to read as follows:

subparagraph.text: orders and contracts under those procedures result in—

clause.text: the lowest overall cost alternative; or

in the case that the Administrator of General Services determines that obtaining best value (as described under section 15.101 of the Federal Acquisition Regulation) is necessary to promote the best interests of the Federal Government, obtaining the best value to meet the needs of the Federal Government.

subsection.text: Section 3012(3)(B) of title 10, United States Code, is amended to read as follows:

subparagraph.text: orders and contracts under those procedures result in—

clause.text: the lowest overall cost alternative; or

in the case that the Administrator of General Services determines that obtaining best value (as described under section 15.101 of the Federal Acquisition Regulation) is necessary to promote the best interests of the Federal Government, obtaining the best value to meet the needs of the United States.
